intro: Oreobolopsis clementis, commonly known as the Clement's oreobolopsis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments. Its flowers are usually small and yellow, with a distinctive tubular structure. Oreobolopsis clementis is often found in open grasslands and is adapted to arid or semi-arid climates.
